brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether a fixed-dose combination of naratriptan
      2,5 mg + naproxen 500 mg is effective and safe compared each monotherapy for the acute
      treatment of migraine.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of a Fixed-dose Combination of Naratriptan and Naproxen in Acute Treatment of Migraine.

intervention.description: Tablets containing naratriptan 2,5 mg + naproxen 500 mg

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, National, Open, Randomized, Parallel and Comparative Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a Fixed-dose Combination of Naratriptan 2,5 mg + Naproxen 500 mg for the Acute Treatment of Migraine.

primary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for pain intensity by using a 4-point rating scale: 0= none, 1= mild, 2= moderate, and 3= severe.
primary_outcome.measure: Headache relief 2 hours after dosing, without use of rescue medication

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for pain intensity by using a 4-point rating scale: 0= none, 1= mild, 2= moderate, and 3= severe
secondary_outcome.measure: Headache relief 4 hours after dosing, without use of rescue medication

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for pain intensity by using a 4-point rating scale: 0=none, 1=mild, 2=moderate, and 3=severe.
secondary_outcome.measure: Maintenance of pain relief between 2 and 24 hours after dosing, without use of rescue medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 24 hours after single dose treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for pain intensity by using a 4-point rating scale: 0= none, 1= mild, 2= moderate, and 3= severe.
secondary_outcome.measure: Pain-free response 2 and 4 hours after dosing, without use of rescue medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 and 4 hours after single dose treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for pain intensity by using a 4-point rating scale: 0= none, 1= mild, 2= moderate, and 3= severe.
secondary_outcome.measure: Maintenance of pain-free response between 2 and 24 hours, without use of rescue medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 24 hours after single dose treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for the presence of vomiting, nausea, photophobia and phonophobia.
secondary_outcome.measure: Freedom from nausea, vomiting, photophobia and phonophobia 2 and 4 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 and 4 hours after single dose treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for the presence of vomiting, nausea, photophobia and phonophobia.
secondary_outcome.measure: Maintenance of freedom from nausea, vomiting, photophobia and phonophobia between 2 and 24 hours after dosing, without use of rescue medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 24 hours after single dose treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) for pain intensity by using a 4-point rating scale: 0= none, 1= mild, 2= moderate, and 3= severe.
secondary_outcome.measure: Recurrence of pain between 2 and 24 hours after dosing, without use of rescue medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 24 hours after single dose treatment

secondary_outcome.description: Participants were evaluated (self-assessment) about use of rescue medication.
secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who used rescue medication between 2 and 24 hours after dosing, at least once
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2 to 24 hours after single dose treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety descriptive about occurence of adverse events, evaluation of results of general physical examination.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collection of safety data throughout the whole study period

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
